revised_title: Endogenous Retroviruses and Cellular Oncogenes: Genetic Transmission and Evolution
tldr: The authors discovered multiple classes of endogenous retroviruses in the cellular DNA of rodents and primates, including two subclasses of type C viruses (C-I and C-II). They found that these retroviruses can be transmitted vertically from parent to progeny and horizontally as infectious particles. The study of these endogenous retroviruses and their genetic elements can help identify new genetic factors involved in neoplasia and the expression of retroviral genes.
